question.content: From which of the following cities does the National Remote Sensing Centre provide acquisition of data and its processing under satellite communication?

solution.content: Hyderabad. National Remote Sensing Centre (NRSC) is one of the primary centers of Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), Department of Space (DOS). Five Regional Centres Jodhpur (Regional Centre-West), New Delhi (Regional Centre-North), New Salt Lake City in Kolkata (Regional Centre-East), Nagpur (Regional Centre-Central), and Bangalore (Regional Centre-South).

question.content: What is the name of the geostationary satellite launched by ISRO in 1983 that provides high power TV broadcasting and telecommunications national coverage transponders?

solution.content: Insat-1B (Indian Satellite 1B) was launched on 30 August 1983, and continued to operate till 1990. Launch Site: Cape Canaveral, United States.

question.content: Who among the following designed the India Gate?

solution.content: Edwin Lutyens. India Gate was constructed in 1931. The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Kartavya path (formerly Raj path) on the eastern edge of the 'ceremonial axis' of New Delhi. 0.2033. The Red Fort is located in: SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Lucknow (b) Delhi (c) Indore (d) Ahmedabad Sol.2033.(b) Delhi. Red Fort: Built by - Shah Jahan (Fifth Mughal Emperor). The fort was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 2007.

question.content: Which of the following is named as Asia's largest slum?

solution.content: Dharavi (Mumbai, Maharashtra). Other Slums In India Bhalswa Slum (Delhi), Nochikuppam Slum (Chennai), Rajendra Nagar Slum (Bangalore), Basanti Slum (Kolkata).

question.content: Which of the following is Tibeto-Burmese language?

solution.content: Tripuri (Kokborok) One of a the official languages of Tripura. Kokborok Day (Tripuri Language Day) 19th January.

question.content: Krishnadeva Raya composed a work on_ in Telugu known as the Amuktamalyada.

solution.content: Statecraft. Krishnadevaraya : Ruler of the Tuluva dynasty of Vijayanagar empire (1509-29 AD).

question.content: Who among the following Indian music directors, specially known as a leading drummer of India, was awarded the Padma Shri in 2019?

solution.content: Sivamani (an Indian percussionist). His stage name - Drums Sivamani.

question.content: The Lomas Rishi cave which is a man made cave is located in which state of India?

solution.content: Bihar. Badami cave temples in Karnataka, India, comprise four caves out of which three are Brahmanical and one is Jain.

question.content: The Rajgir Zoo is located in which of the following states?

solution.content: Bihar. Zoos in India: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens (Karnataka), Nandankanan Zoological Park (Odisha), Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park (Maharashtra).

question.content: In which year did Narendra Modi proposed to celebrate a day for yoga as 'International Day of Yoga' while speaking at the United Nations General Assembly?

solution.content: 2014. The United Nations proclaimed 21st June as International day of yoga (IDY). The first Yoga Day celebrations (2015). Theme: 'Yoga for Harmony and Peace. The 9th IDY, 2023 Theme: "Yoga for Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam,".

question.content: In which of the following years did the Indian team win the ODI cricket world cup?
What was the style of architecture used in Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara, Gujarat?

solution.content: Indo-Saracenic. Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara was built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1890.

question.content: Rani Ki Vav (the Queen's stepwell) is situated on the banks of which river?

solution.content: Saraswati. Rani-ki-Vav (UNESCO World Heritage Site) Its construction is attributed to Udayamati (the spouse of the 11th-century Chaulukya king Bhima 1) in Patan (Gujarat). It is on the new 100 rupee note (coloured Lavender).

question.content: Bhopal gas disaster occurred in Which of the following factories?

solution.content: Union Carbide Pesticide Plant. Bhopal Gas Disaster occurred on Dec 3, 1984. Methyl Isocyanate (C₂H₂NO) gas leaked from the plant of Union Carbide. Warren Anderson was the CEO of the Union Carbide Corporation at the time of Bhopal Gas tragedy.

question.content: The famous Sheesh Mahal in Punjab was built by which of the following rulers?

solution.content: Maharaja Narinder Singh. Sheesh Mahal - It is located in Patiala (Punjab).

question.content: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, was formerly known as

solution.content: Victoria Terminus Station. The Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (Mumbai), is an example of Indo-Gothic Style of architecture. Architect 'F. W. Stevens'. It was recognised as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2004 and is the headquarters of Indian Central Railway.

question.content: How many UNESCO Natural World Heritage sites are there in India?

solution.content: Seven. UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage Convention which was established in 1972.

question.content: Lomas Rishi cave is situated in which of the following Hills?

solution.content: Barabar Hills (Bihar). It was constructed by emperor Ashoka for the use of Ajivaka. Buddhist, Hindu and Jain sculptures are also found there. It includes four caves - Lomas Rishi Caves, Sudama caves, Vishwakarma Caves, and Karan Chaupar caves. The Barabar Hill Caves are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India.

question.content: Rabindranath Tagore started Shantiniketan institute in

solution.content: 1901. Santiniketan literally means "abode of peace" in Bengali.

question.content: Which of the following is NOT a family in classification of Modern Indian Languages?

solution.content: Indo-african. People of India speak a large number of languages which are broadly divided into the following four families: Indo-European Family (Arya), Dravidian Family (Dravida), Austric Family (Nishada), and Sino Tibetan Family (Kirata).

question.content: The amount of water recommended by the United Nations for drinking, washing, cooking and maintaining proper hygiene is a minimum of litres per person per day.

solution.content: 50 litres. This amount is about two and a half buckets of water per person per day.

question.content: is an ancient martial art that originated in peninsular India as a part of military training for warriors.

solution.content: Kalaripayattu is a martial art based on the ancient knowledge of the human body. It originated in Kerala during 3nd century BC to the 2nd century AD.

question.content: According to WHO, if a person's BMI is below 18.5 he/she is classified as

solution.content: Underweight. BMI (Body mass Index)- It is an individual weight in kilograms (or pounds) divided by the square of height in meters (or feet). According to WHO, for adults over 20 years old, BMI falls into- Underweight (less than 18.5), Normal (18.5 24.9), Overweight (25 29.9), Obesity (30 34.9), Severely obese(35 - 39.9) Morbid obesity (more than 40).

question.content: Who is the first Indian President to be born in Independent India?

solution.content: Droupadi Murmu. She was born in 1958 in Odisha. She took oath as the 15th President of India on July 25, 2022. She has become the first tribal (Santali) and the second woman President. She became the first woman Governor of Jharkhand.

question.content: Who hosted the first meeting of India-Central Asia Summit?

solution.content: India. Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi hosted the first meeting of the India-Central Asia Summit on 27 January 2022.

question.content: India's short-range Ballistic Missile, Prithvi II was successfully test fired from

solution.content: Chandipur, Odisha. Submarine Launched Ballistic Missiles- Ashwin, Sagarika, K-4 and K-5. Surface -to-surface Missiles Prithvi I, Prithvi II, Agni (I- V), Dhanush, Prahar and Shaurya (Medium-Range Ballistic Missile).

question.content: The length of the badminton court for singles is

solution.content: 13.40 m (44ft). The width for singles court is 5.18m (17 feet), while for the doubles court, the width is 6.1m (20 feet).The diagonal length of the full court is 14.723 m.

question.content: The world's highest motorable road passes through. India, as of 2022.

solution.content: Umling La. It connects Chisumle and Demchok village. The Border Roads Organization (BRO) has constructed the road at an altitude of 19,300 feet. Highest motorable roads in India - Dungri La (Uttarakhand,18,406 ft), Marsimik La (Jammu & Kashmir, 18,314 ft), Donkia La (Sikkim,18,045 ft), Photi La, (Jammu & Kashmir - 18,124 ft), Khardung La (Jammu & Kashmir - 17,583 ft) etc.

question.content: Which among the following is India's first indigenously developed COVID-19 vaccine?

solution.content: COVAXIN - India's first indigenous COVID-19 vaccine by Bharat Biotech is developed in collaboration with the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) National Institute of Virology (NIV). Covishield manufactured by Serum Institute of India Private Limited (Pune). Sputnik V developed by Russia.

question.content: ISRO successfully launched the communication satellite GSAT-24 from

solution.content: Kourou in French Guiana. GSAT-24 is a 24-Ku band communication satellite (23 June 2022) meant for meeting the DirectTo-Home (DTH) communication needs of the country, built by ISRO (15 August 1969) for NewSpace India Limited (NSIL).

question.content: How many non-major (minor) ports are there in India as on 31st October 2022?

solution.content: 200. India has 13 major ports and more than 200 notified minor and intermediate ports. Kolkata Port is the only riverine port in India. Mumbai Port is the biggest port in India in terms of size and shipping traffic.

question.content: Market Based Economic Dispatch (MBED) Mechanism is related with which of the following ministry?

options.text: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises

solution.content: The Ministry of Power. The Electricity Act, 2003 An Act to consolidate the laws relating to generation, transmission, distribution, trading and use of electricity.

question.content: Intermediate Range Ballistic Missile Agni-4 has been successfully test fired in

options.text: Neil Island, Andaman and Nicobar Islands

solution.content: APJ Abdul Kalam Island, Odisha. The Agni-IV (range 4000 Km) is a two-stage surface-to-surface missile. It has been developed by DRDO (Defence Research and Development Organisation).

question.content: Which among the following is a surface-to-surface missile of India?

solution.content: Agni V {(range around 5000 km 5500 km), developed by Defence Research and Development Organisation} is a ballistic missile developed under the Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme (IGMDP). On October 27, 2021, (test fired on) the country celebrated 75th infantry day. The missiles developed under IGMDP (established in 1983) are Prithvi, Agni, Trishul, Akash, Nag.

question.content: The S-400 Triumf (Russian for Triumph) Missile System is _ missile defence system designed in Russia.

solution.content: surfacetoair. This System is an anti-aircraft missile defence system developed by Russia's Almaz Central Design Bureau.

question.content: "Statue of Equality" has been inaugurated in Hyderabad in the memory of

solution.content: Saint Ramanujacharya. Statue of Equality: Height 216 feet. Material - Panchaloha. Statue of Unity Tallest statue in world 182 meters Located in Kevadia, Narmada District, Gujarat. Swami Vivekanand Statue - 33 ft tall - Ranchi Jharkhand.

question.content: Chandigarh International Airport has been renamed as

solution.content: Shaheed Bhagat Singh International Airport (Chandigarh, Punjab). Guru Gobind Singh Airport (Maharashtra). Amritsar International Airport renamed as Sri Guru Ram Das Jee International Airport (Amritsar, Punjab). Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (Kolkata). Bharat Ratna Babasaheb Dr. B.R. Ambedkar International Airport (Nagpur, Maharashtra).

question.content: When was the None of the Above (NOTA) ballot option first implemented in India? SSC CGL Tier II 07/03/2023

solution.content: 2013. "None of the above" (NOTA): It does not hold any electoral value, it allows the voter to indicate disapproval of all of the candidates, it does not provide for a 'right to reject'.

question.content: When was 'Vayudoot' airline setup in India?

solution.content: 1981. The airline was headquartered at New Delhi's Safdarjung Airport. It ceased operations on 1 April 1997. Air India (J.R.D Tata, 1932,). Kingfisher airlines (Vijay Mallya, 2003, Ceased operations: 20 October 2012).

question.content: The railway system connecting St Petersburg to Vladivostok is

solution.content: The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway system connecting St. Petersburg in Western Russia to Vladivostok on the Pacific coast. India's longest distance train (Vivek Express Dibrugarh to Kanyakumari-4189 km).

question.content: The word Manuscripts derived from which of the following languages?

solution.content: Latin. The manuscript word evolved from the Latin Manu Scriptus, meaning "written by hand." Manu is "hand" and Scriptus is "to write."

question.content: At present, the Grand Trunk Road extends from in India.

solution.content: Amritsar to Kolkata. Grand Trunk Road was built by Sher Shah Suri in the 16th century. National Highway 1 is known as Sher Shah Suri Marg.

question.content: Which city is called the 'Manchester of India'?

solution.content: Ahmedabad - Boston of East'. Visakhapatnam - City of Destiny,. Jaipur - Pink City. Surat - Silk City of India, Diamond City of India. Akola - Cotton City of India. Coorg (Karnataka) Scotland of India.

question.content: The 'flag-raising' ceremony by the Prime Minister of India on Independence Day is held at which of the following places in Delhi?

solution.content: Red Fort. Independence Day is to mark India's rise as an independent country and the end of British rule. Republic Day President of India unfurls the flag on Rajpath (kartavya path).

question.content: is called Developing place of settlement

solution.content: site. Types of settlements: Compact or Nucleated settlements (develop along river valleys and in fertile plains) and Dispersed Settlements (a place of worship or a market, binds the settlement together). Rural settlement patterns (linear pattern, cross shaped pattern, star like pattern, T-shape pattern, circular pattern, double pattern). Urban settlements (town, city, conurbation, million city).

question.content: What is the duration of the lunch interval in a cricket test match?

solution.content: 40 minutes. Tea break in test cricket lasts for 20 minutes. The first Test match was between Australia and England in Melbourne in 1877. The first test match in India was played between India and England in Bombay Gymkhana ground (Mumbai) in 1933. C.K. Naidu - then the Captain of India.

question.content: The National Archives of India came up in the

solution.content: 1920s. The Imperial Record Department (Now- The National Archives of India) was set up on 11 March 1891 in Calcutta (Kolkata). In 1926 the Department was shifted into its new building in New Delhi. It is the biggest archival repository in South Asia.

question.content: Which series of satellite carrying Very High-Resolution Radiometer (VHRR) provides valuable observations of temperature, cloud cover, wind and related weather phenomena?

solution.content: INSAT Series. The Indian National Satellite System is a series of geostationary satellites launched by ISRO.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are true about the communication development in India? A. TV services began in India before Independence. B. TV was delinked from All India Radio. C. Doordarshan got a separate identity in 1976.

solution.content: Both B and C. Television started in India on September 15, 1959. Doordarshan (1959), Headquarters-New Delhi. All India Radio (AIR), officially known since 1957 as Akashvani is the national public radio broadcaster of India and is a division of Prasar Bharati. It was established in 1936.

question.content: Air transport was launched in India in the year 1911 between which two places?

solution.content: Allahabad and Naini (short distance of 10km). Indian National Airways (1933, between Karachi and Lahore). Airports Authority of India {Founded (1 April 1995), Headquarters (New Delhi), Longest air route in India {Srinagar (J&K) to Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar)}.

question.content: Who among the following is the architect of the World Heritage site, Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus in Mumbai?

solution.content: FW Stevens (Frederick William Stevens). Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (Headquarters of Central Railway), Former name Victoria Terminus. George Wittet - The Gateway of India (Mumbai). Vincent Esch and William Emerson - Victoria memorial hall (Kolkata).

question.content: On 26 January 1950, the first ever Republic Day parade was performed at

solution.content: Irwin Amphitheatre (President Sukarno of Indonesia was the Chief guest in 1950). The first Republic Day parade at the Rajpath was held in 1955, five years after India became a republic.

question.content: Which of the Sustainable Development Goals set by the United Nations aims to achieve universal health coverage that seeks equal access to health services for all men and women?

solution.content: SDG 3 (Good Health and Well-being).

question.content: Which of the following political parties led the Punjabi Suba movement in India?

solution.content: Shiromani Akali Dal (Political Party) was leading the Punjabi Suba movement for a Punjabi-speaking state. Slogans were raised 'Punjabi Suba Amar Rahe' (in favour of demand) and 'Maha-Punjab' (Opposing the demand). With the passage of the Punjab Reorganization Act 1966, Haryana was separated from Punjab in 1966 to become the 17th state of India.

question.content: What was the former name of the Yamuna Expressway Project constructed in Uttar Pradesh, India?

solution.content: Taj Expressway. It is presently India's 3rd longest expressway since February 2017.

question.content: Assam and most of the Peninsular states have _ population densities.

solution.content: Moderate. The Population density in Assam is 398 per sq km.

question.content: The study of human populations including their size, composition and distribution across space and the process through which populations change is called

solution.content: Demography. Ethnography is a branch of anthropology and the systematic study of individual cultures. Topography is the study of the forms and features of land surfaces. Stenography is the art or process of writing in shorthand.

question.content: industrial agriculture. is also known as

solution.content: Intensive farming. Q.2089 With respect to communication, 'Doordarshan' in India is a SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Afternoon) (a) National web browser (b) National radio channel (c) National television channel (d) National newspaper Sol.2089.(c) National television channel . On 15 September 1959, the Government of India launched Doordarshan, India's public service broadcaster in Delhi, later in 1982 it became a national broadcaster.

question.content: Which of the following is the first six-lane expressway in India?

solution.content: Mumbai Pune Expressway. Purvanchal Expressway (Lucknow- Ghazipur).Yamuna Expressway (Noida to Agra).

question.content: The Barabati Fort is situated in the city of.

solution.content: Cuttack. More Forts in Odisha: Chudanga Gada Fort (Bhubaneswar), Raibania Fort (Baleswar district), Sisupalgarh Fort (Bhubaneswar), Asurgarh Fort (Kalahandi district), Potagarh Fort. Gulbarga Fort - Karnataka.

question.content: The aviation sector was inaugurated in India in the year with the establishment of Tata Airlines.

solution.content: 1932. The airline, founded by J.R.D Tata, started as an airmail carrier within India after winning a contract with Imperial Airways. The airline flew its inaugural flight in October 1932, flying from Karachi to Mumbai.

question.content: Who among the following founded the 'Shillong Chamber Choir'?

solution.content: Neil Nongkinrih. The Shillong Chamber Choir, established in 2001, is a multi-genre choir, which won the reality TV show India's Got Talent in 2010.

question.content: In which year was the 'Lotteries Regulation Act' passed?

solution.content: 1998. The Lotteries Regulation Act, 1998 is an important piece of legislation that lays down thorough guidelines for the central government to conduct lotteries in India.

question.content: Which of the following is an indigenous dairy breed of cattle?

solution.content: Red Sindhi is a reputed heat tolerant milch cattle breed originating from Sindh province of Pakistan. The Chippiparai is a breed of sighthound from Tamil Nadu in southern India. The Kanni is a rare indigenous South Indian sighthound breed of dog. The Kombai or Polygar dog is a breed of sighthound native to Tamil Nadu.

question.content: _ is one of the languages in which the denomination is printed on the reverse of a contemporary Indian currency note.

solution.content: Nepali. Sinhala, is an Indo-Aryan language primarily spoken by the Sinhalese people of Sri Lankа.

question.content: The fine for extinguishing public lamps may extend to as per Section 141 of The Electricity Act, 2003.

solution.content: 2,000. The Electricity Act, 2003 is an Act of the Parliament of India enacted to transform the power sector in India.

question.content: What is the maximum permissible limit of turbidity in potable water as per the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) (IS-10500: 2012)?

solution.content: 5 NTU. NTU stands for Nephelometric Turbidity unit, i.e. the unit used to measure the turbidity of a fluid or the presence of suspended particles in water. Turbidity is a measure of the cloudiness of water. On a standard silica scale, the permissible value of turbidity for drinking water is 10 (ppm).

question.content: Who among the following was a saint from Maharashtra?

solution.content: Chokhamela. Dadu Dayal was a poet-saint from Gujarat.

question.content: For which of the following productions is the Ramagundam power plant famous?

solution.content: Thermal energy. Ramagundam power plant - It is part of the National Thermal Power Corporation, a 2600 MW power station located in Ramagundam, Telangana.

question.content: Which of the following is the name of the spacecraft developed by SpaceX for NASA's manned mission to the International Space Station?  Crew Centaurus (c) Crew Shark (Afternoon) (b) Crew Dragon (d) Crew Aries

solution.content: Crew Dragon is the name of the spacecraft developed by SpaceX for NASA'S manned mission to the International Space Station. NASA headquarters is in Washington DC.

question.content: Which is the national heritage animal of India?

solution.content: Elephant (2010). Project Elephant (PE) was launched by the Government of India in the year 1992.

question.content: Unique Transaction Reference number is a _ character code used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system.

solution.content: 22. Unique Transaction Reference number used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system. It is used to identify a specific bank transaction in India. All banks in India use UTR numbers for all types of money transfers.

question.content: Who among the following was the founder of Homeopathy?

solution.content: Samuel Hahnemann espoused the law of cure known as "Similia Similibus Curentur", or "Like Cures Like".

question.content: SIMBEX is a military exercise conducted between the defense forces of which of the following nations?

solution.content: India and Singapore. India and Thailand (Maitree, CORPAT), India and the US (Vajra Prahar, Yudh Abhyas), India and Sri Lanka (Mitra Shakti).

question.content: Who among the following is the founder of the field of psychoanalysis?

solution.content: Sigmund Freud. Carl Jung- Founded analytical psychology. Kai T Erikson- specializing in the social consequences of catastrophic events. Jean Piaget Worked on child development.

question.content: Which of the following is the largest sea bird with the longest wingspan?

solution.content: Wandering Albatross. The maximum dimensions in this species are a length of 1.44 m (4.7 ft) and а wingspan of 3.65 m (12.0 ft).

question.content: 'Oolong' is a variant of

solution.content: Tea. Oolong It is a traditional semi-oxidized Chinese tea. It is made from the leaves of the Camellia Sinensis plant. The same plant is used to make Green tea and Black tea.

question.content: The rupee symbol, which was introduced in India in 2010, is an amalgamation of the Devanagari 'Ra' and the 'R' without the stem.

solution.content: Roman. The Indian Rupee sign was adopted by the Government of India on 15th July 2010. Udaya Kumar won a national contest to design a symbol for the Indian rupee.

question.content: Hakki, Pikki and Siddi are _ from Karnataka.

solution.content: Language. These languages are critically endangered in Karnataka. Hakki, Pikki and Siddi is a mix of Konkani, Kannada and Hindi. Kannada is the official language of Karnataka.

question.content: In which year was the Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) established in India?

solution.content: 1972. The Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) is a statutory body that was established under the Ministry of Commerce and Industry for the promotion of the export of marine products from India.

question.content: Since 2000, Euro norms are followed in India under the name Stage Emission Standards for four wheeled vehicles.

solution.content: Bharat. Vehicle emission norms were introduced in India in 1991 for petrol and in 1992 for diesel vehicles.

question.content: When was the Editors Guild of India founded?

solution.content: 1978. It was established with the twin objectives of protecting press freedom and raising the standards of editorial leadership of newspapers and magazines.

question.content: Where was the first factory of the Indian Iron and Steel Company (IISCO) set up?

solution.content: Hirapur. IISCO Steel Plant of Steel Authority of India Limited is an integrated steel plant located at Hirapur (later to be called Burnpur) in the Asansol subdivision of Paschim Bardhaman district, West Bengal.

question.content: Where is the Rumi Darwaza located?

solution.content: Lucknow. It is an imposing gateway that was built by Nawab Asaf-Ud-Daula in 1784.

question.content: In the context of forest conservation, Navadanya Movement was founded in 1987 by

solution.content: Vandana Shiva. Navdanya is an Indian-based non-governmental organization that promotes biodiversity conservation, biodiversity, organic farming, the rights of farmers, and the process of seed saving.

question.content: Actor Kamal Haasan is the Founder President of the political party

solution.content: Makkal Needhi Maiam Party (Tamilnadu state territory of Puducherry). and union

question.content: How many windows are there on the outside walls of Hawa Mahal of Jaipur?

solution.content: 953. Hawa Mahal of Jaipur was designed by Lal Chand Ustad.

question.content: In which color are the railway lines and telephone lines shown in the topographic map?

solution.content: Black Railroads, boundaries, telephone lines. Brown Topographic contours. Blue - Lakes, streams, irrigation ditches and other hydrographic features Red - Land grids and important roads.

question.content: Which of the following animals is used for transport in Tibet?

solution.content: Yak. It is commonly found in Tibet, Ladakh and Sikkim. It is used as a beast of burden and is also reared for its wool, milk and meat.

question.content: Which of the following was previously known as 'the Lady Willingdon Park.

solution.content: Lodhi Garden. Lady Willingdon Park was inaugurated in April 1936.

question.content: Which ISO certification pertains to Environmental Management Systems?

solution.content: 14001. ISO 22000 - It is an international standard for food safety established by the International Organization for Standardization.

question.content: Which of the following martial art forms is practiced in the state of Punjab and West Bengal?

solution.content: Lathi (stick). Mardaani Khel is from Maharashtra.

question.content: Which of the following animals does NOT find a place in the National Emblem of India?

solution.content: Camel. The Emblem is a replica of the Lion of Sarnath, near Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh. The abacus is girded by four smaller animals- guardians of the four directions: the lion of the north, the elephant of the east, the horse of the south and the bull of the west.

question.content: Who designed the logo for Lokpal in India?

solution.content: Prashant Mishra. The logo of Lokpal: LOK people and PAL - caretaker, i.e. "caretaker of people". 7/7
